    • Method Detail

      • startVM

        public void startVM(VirtualMachine virtualMachine,
                    FrontEndType frontEndType)
        Method that implements the method VirtualMachineManager::startVM(VirtualMachine, FrontEndType.
        This method is implemented to start the required virtual machine with the specified front-end type FrontEndType. If any error occurs, then there can be thrown the following exceptions:
        • ConnectionFailureException - thrown when there occured any connection problem (invalid physical machine attribute values, not running web server, network connection not working properly or at all) when the native VirtualBox manager object is being retrieved or when the physical machine is not connected
        • UnknownVirtualMachineException - thrown when the given virtual machine is being retrieved from remote physical machine, but that virtual machine does not exist (is not registered at the VirtualBox hypervisor) on the remote physical machine
        • UnexpectedVMStateException - thrown when the virtual machine cannot be accessed (e.g. corrupted configuration files) or when the virtual machine is in a not required state ("running","paused") for starting operation or the starting operation is aborted because of the another process which is using the virtual machine at the same moment.
        • IllegalArgumentException - thrown when the given virtual machine is null or the given front-end type is null
        Specified by:
        startVM in interface VirtualMachineManager
        Parameters:
        virtualMachine - virtual machine which should be started
        frontEndType - type of front-end used for virtual machine

      • shutDownVM

        public void shutDownVM(VirtualMachine virtualMachine)
        Method that implements the method VirtualMachineManager::shutDownVM(VirtualMachine.
        This method is implemented to shut down the required virtual machine like the machine was unplugged. So it is fast, but no state are saved and any data can be lost. If any error occurs, then there can be thrown the following exceptions:
        • ConnectionFailureException - thrown when there occured any connection problem (invalid physical machine attribute values, not running web server, network connection not working properly or at all) when the native VirtualBox manager object is being retrieved or when the physical machine is not connected
        • UnknownVirtualMachineException - thrown when the given virtual machine is being retrieved from remote physical machine, but that virtual machine does not exist (is not registered at the VirtualBox hypervisor) on the remote physical machine
        • UnexpectedVMStateException - thrown when the virtual machine cannot be accessed (e.g. corrupted configuration files) or when the virtual machine is not in a required state ("running", "paused", "stuck") for shut down operation
        • IllegalArgumentException - thrown when the given virtual machine is null
        Specified by:
        shutDownVM in interface VirtualMachineManager
        Parameters:
        virtualMachine - virtual machine which should be shut down

      • addPortRule

        public void addPortRule(VirtualMachine virtualMachine,
                        PortRule portRule)
        Method that imlements method VirtualMachineManager::addPortRule(VirtualMachine, PortRule).
        If there occurs any error, then the following exceptions can be thrown:
        • ConnectionFailureException - thrown when there occured any connection problem (invalid physical machine attribute values, not running web server, network connection not working properly or at all) when the native VirtualBox manager object is being retrieved or when the physical machine is not connected
        • UnknownVirtualMachineException - thrown when the given virtual machine is being retrieved from remote physical machine, but that virtual machine does not exist (is not registered at the VirtualBox hypervisor) on the remote physical machine
        • UnexpectedVMStateException - thrown when the virtual machine is not attached to the NAT network adapter -> no port-forwarding can be done
        • IllegalArgumentException - thrown when the given virtual machine is null or the given port rule is not valid
        Specified by:
        addPortRule in interface VirtualMachineManager
        Parameters:
        virtualMachine - virtual machine to which a new port-forwarding rule should be added
        portRule - a new port-forwarding rule

      • deletePortRule

        public void deletePortRule(VirtualMachine virtualMachine,
                           PortRule portRule)
        Method that implements the method VirtualMachineManager::deletePortRule(VirtualMachine,PortRule).
        • ConnectionFailureException - thrown when there occured any connection problem (invalid physical machine attribute values, not running web server, network connection not working properly or at all) when the native VirtualBox manager object is being retrieved or when the physical machine is not connected
        • UnknownVirtualMachineException - thrown when the given virtual machine is being retrieved from remote physical machine, but that virtual machine does not exist (is not registered at the VirtualBox hypervisor) on the remote physical machine
        • UnexpectedVMStateException - thrown when the virtual machine is not attached to the NAT network adapter -> no port-forwarding can be done
        • IllegalArgumentException - thrown when the given virtual machine is null or the given port rule is not valid
        • UnknownPortRuleException - thrown when there is made an attempt to delete a non-existent port-forwarding rule
        Specified by:
        deletePortRule in interface VirtualMachineManager
        Parameters:
        virtualMachine - virtual machine from which the port-forwarding rule should be deleted
        portRule - a port-forwarding rule which should be deleted

      • deleteAllPortRules

        public void deleteAllPortRules(VirtualMachine virtualMachine)
        Method that implements the method VirtualMachineManager::deleteAllPortRules(VirtualMachine).
        The implementation of this method uses the implementation of method deletePortRule(VirtualMachine, PortRule). If there occurs any error, then the following exceptions can be thrown:
        • ConnectionFailureException - thrown when there occured any connection problem (invalid physical machine attribute values, not running web server, network connection not working properly or at all) when the native VirtualBox manager object is being retrieved or when the physical machine is not connected
        • UnknownVirtualMachineException - thrown when the given virtual machine is being retrieved from remote physical machine, but that virtual machine does not exist (is not registered at the VirtualBox hypervisor) on the remote physical machine
        • UnexpectedVMStateException - thrown when the virtual machine is not attached to the NAT network adapter -> no port-forwarding can be done
        • IllegalArgumentException - thrown when the given virtual machine is null
        Specified by:
        deleteAllPortRules in interface VirtualMachineManager
        Parameters:
        virtualMachine - virtual machine from which all its port-forwarding rules will be removed

      • getPortRules

        public java.util.List<PortRule> getPortRules(VirtualMachine virtualMachine)
        Method that implements the method VirtualMachineManager::getPortRules(VirtualMachine).
        This method returns all existing port-forwarding rules of a particular virtual machine. If there occurs any error, then the following exceptions can be thrown:
        • ConnectionFailureException - thrown when there occured any connection problem (invalid physical machine attribute values, not running web server, network connection not working properly or at all) when the native VirtualBox manager object is being retrieved or when the physical machine is not connected
        • UnknownVirtualMachineException - thrown when the given virtual machine is being retrieved from remote physical machine, but that virtual machine does not exist (is not registered at the VirtualBox hypervisor) on the remote physical machine
        • UnexpectedVMStateException - thrown when the virtual machine is not attached to the NAT network adapter -> no port-forwarding can be done
        • IllegalArgumentException - thrown when the given virtual machine is null
        Specified by:
        getPortRules in interface VirtualMachineManager
        Parameters:
        virtualMachine - virtual machine from which are retrieved all its registered port-forwarding rules
        Returns:
        list of all registered port-forwarding rules of a particular virtual machine

      • getVMState

        public java.lang.String getVMState(VirtualMachine virtualMachine)
        Method that implements the method VirtualMachineManager#getVMState(VirtualMachine)
        This method gets the actual state of a particular virtual machine. If there occurs any error, then the following exceptions can be thrown:
        • ConnectionFailureException - thrown when there occured any connection problem (invalid physical machine attribute values, not running web server, network connection not working properly or at all) when the native VirtualBox manager object is being retrieved or when the physical machine is not connected
        • UnknownVirtualMachineException - thrown when the given virtual machine is being retrieved from remote physical machine, but that virtual machine does not exist (is not registered at the VirtualBox hypervisor) on the remote physical machine
        • UnexpectedVMStateException - thrown when the virtual machine cannot be accessed (e.g. corrupted configuration files) operation
        • IllegalArgumentException - thrown when the given virtual machine is null
        Specified by:
        getVMState in interface VirtualMachineManager
        Parameters:
        virtualMachine - represents the queried virtual machine
        Returns:
        the actual state of the virtual machine as string
